User says watching reels on the phone is easier because it isn’t buffering at all like the MR Display reels were.

User believes that service/internet connect is worse at the light green chair and better at the dark green chair due to perhaps proximity to the Wi-Fi. User recalls that connection wasn’t ideal during the voice call in the first session.

Switched glasses to pair #9. Glasses ID 2Y0YB85H4X001B
Still using the same band but new phone #9 Pauline Claire.

Switched glasses because the other ones were buffering too much. User couldn’t watch reels on the glasses. User tried to test the theory that it was due to location and switched back to the dark green chair. Reels still didn’t work. User decided it was the glasses. New glasses are working fine.

User says that when looking at the light cream curtains, the display is very dim and difficult to see. User looked at the striped carpet on the lines and said it was very overwhelming and hard to pay attention to the display. Then user looked at the dark wood table and said the display “was more vivid and easier to see. More bright and colorful so I could see it better.”
User is holding hand flat against the lenses to see the reels better. About half an inch of space between the hand and the lenses.
The new glasses buffered again for a few seconds then went back on. User said “weird”.
User finds the buffering annoying but the previous pair of glasses were worse with the buffering problem.
User asked if there was a way to see how good the connection on the glasses are. “Like when you check the service bars on the phone.”

User is watching reels on the phone screen.

User is feeling sleepy. Says they feel like dozing off.

User has a theory that the glasses can sense when user’s eyes are closed and that is what is causing the videos to stop.
